article:
It was at 6 a.m that I arrived in the hospital kitchen. "Hi, I'm Janet." I tried to sound cheerful, although I already knew that it was    _    to work with Rose. 
Rose, a middle-aged woman, stopped what she was doing and   looked at   me over her glasses. I could tell from her expression that she wasn't   _   to see a student worker. 
"What do you want me to do?   _    the coffee?" Rose   _   and went away. I filled the pot with cold water and began making coffee when Rose suddenly   _   and took over, "That's not the   _   to make coffee." I was   _   as I just followed the steps our supervisor   showed us. 
  _  I did pleased her. All morning her eyes missed nothing and her words   _   me. Totally tired, I came home late that afternoon. Fighting back   _   , I thought of my situation alone in my room. Should I see if my supervisor would change my   _  ? But I didn't want to   give in   . Then I had the answer -- I needed to   _   her.
Working with Rose the next morning, I   _    her sharp   words and did things in her way as much as possible. Things began to    change   over the next few days. She became   _   to me. As I worked with this   _  woman, I listened to her -- something no one else had done. 
I never   _   Rose again after that summer,   _   I still remember her. That summer I learned a lesson that love is the best way to turn an enemy   into a friend.
